before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"1rrsg","text":"D19 iPSC derived ventral midbrain progenitors are used in this protocol\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fh7tp","text":"This protocol outlines the preparation of iPSC derived ventral midbrain progenitors for xenotransplantation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"2avus","text":"All work is to be conducted in well sterilised laminar flow hoods designated for human iPSC work where possible to minimise contamination","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: ASAPCRN,transplantation, ventral midbrain, iPSC, cell preparation, neurons

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step:
{"blocks":[{"key":"7k820","text":" Wash wells with 1 x PBS -/- ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2jume","text":"Incubate cells in   of Accutase per cm2 at  . Note: D19 typically dissociate between 10-20mins.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":38,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":46,"length":49}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":18,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":43,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7o9fj","text":"Prepare a   falcon tube for cells. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":10,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1csj7","text":"Check dissociation after   by using a p1000 to pipette up and down twice onto the
cells. Observe if cells dislodge and are present in small clumps of 5-10 cells.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":25,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3hphq","text":" If YES: Collect all cells into a   tube. Wash wells with Accutase to ensure all
cells are collected.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":34,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c6p8","text":"If NO:  Incubate plate for intervals of   Pipette suspension up and down twice targeting
the large clumps/sheets at each interval to promote dissociation. Repeat until cells are dissociated into small clumps when you can transfer to a   tube. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":3,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":40,"length":1},{"key":6,"offset":235,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"484","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"15","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":360,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"4":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"15","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"5":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"6":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"15","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aubea","text":"Add Ri (1:1000)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"db6r1","text":"Incubate the tube for   intervals until cells are broken into mostly single cells/small clumps (~5cells).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":22,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8bqnm","text":"Cancel the reaction with PBS -/- at a 1:1 dilution to Accutase.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9rgb9","text":"Spin cells ( )","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":12,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"300","duration":180,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d6tfi","text":"Aspirate supernatant. Flick pellet twice.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"evm93","text":" Resuspend in NBB27 + All (~2ml per 48well) + Ri 1:1000. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a15d1","text":"Resuspend suspension and pipette   into a small Eppendorf tube for cell counting. Repeat\nfor a second Eppendorf tube.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":33,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"q1a2","text":"Take 2 tubes and add   trypan blue to cells in each tube. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":21,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f3j4i","text":"Transfer   of mixed cells in haemocytometer.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":9,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7rrt5","text":"Count cells in each quadrant.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9l1a4","text":"Calculate total number of cells. Repeat this for tube 2 to ensure accurate cell counts. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1kjf2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7elf9","text":"Total cells = Average count of quadrants x Dilution factor x Volume (ml) x 10^4","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":79}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f1q9t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"espo0","text":"8.  Calculate the total volume needed to resuspend cells to a final density (typically between 100-150K/µl)and the amount of Ri 1:1000 required.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f9tlm","text":"9.  Spin cells ( )","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":16,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"3":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"300","duration":180,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1t80u","text":"Aspirate supernatant.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"enu3i","text":"Add half the required media on top of the cells gently (i.e. if you have 2 million cells total final volume is  to achieve 100 000 cells/µL so add  of media (NBB27 + All + Ri 1:1000) to pellet. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":111,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":147,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"108lk","text":"Using a P20 gently disturb the pellet in a circular motion, taking care not to damage cells by hitting the edge of the tube with the pipette tip. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jrjn","text":"Once mixed, take up the suspension once or twice and transfer to a small Eppendorf tube. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vmju","text":"Measure the volume of cell suspension.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2aesa","text":"Add the appropriate volume of NBB27 + All + Ri 1:1000 required to reach the final volume. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":62,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a6055","text":"Place cells on ice and transfer to surgical room immediately for transplantation. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2mchk","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"70g6v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ep87i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}
